        <h2>What to Expect</h2>

        <p>The six-day international programme comprises five intensive workshop days (09:00-16:00 daily) and a field excursion in Wales. The structure will combine training, dialogue, and experimentation:</p>
        
        <ul>
            <li><strong>Thematic Keynotes</strong> from leading scholars and practitioners.</li>
            <li><strong>Research Spotlights</strong> where PhDs and ECRs present their work.</li>
            <li><strong>Workshops & Tutorials</strong> on probabilistic modelling, scenario planning, foresight, and speculative futures.</li>
            <li><strong>Interdisciplinary Case Studies</strong> on challenges like climate adaptation or AI governance.</li>
            <li><strong>Creativity Sessions</strong> using improvisation, art, storytelling, and signal sharing.</li>
            <li><strong>Ethics & Policy Dialogues</strong> connecting research to government and industry.</li>
            <li><strong>Day 6 Excursion in Wales</strong> for site visits and outdoor reflection.</li>
        </ul>


    </div>

    <div class="content-card">
        <h2>Who Should Apply</h2>
        <p>The summer school is aimed at PhD students, postdoctoral researchers, practitioners, and early-career academics from across disciplines. The cohort will consist of up to 40 participants, selected to ensure diversity and depth of engagement.</p>
        
        <p>To strengthen local capacity, around <strong>one-third of places will be reserved for Cardiff postgraduate researchers (PGRs) and early career researchers (ECRs)</strong>, while international recruitment will ensure broad cross-cultural exchange. Participants will also connect with the Hwb Dyfodol network of futures practitioners in Wales.</p>
    </div>
    
    <div class="content-card">
        <h2>Venue & Fees</h2>
        <p>The summer school will be held at Cardiff University, using its modern seminar rooms and collaborative spaces. Accommodation will be arranged in university residences, with catering provided for lunches and breaks.</p>
    </div>
